1.q_string: The r.m.s value of an alternating current of \(50 Hz\) is \(10 A\). The time taken by the alternating current in reaching from zero to maximum value and the peak value of current will be:

A capacitor of capacitance \(2 mF\) and resistor of resistance \(12 \Omega\) are connected in series with voltage source \(V =(195 \sqrt{2} volts )[\sin (100 rad / s ) t ]\). The average power dissipated in the circuit will be?

In an \(A C\) circuit with resistance \(R=1 \Omega\) and oscillating potential \(v=\) \(v _{ m } \sin \omega t\), where \(v _{ m }=1 V\) and \(\omega=2 \pi~ rad / s\), at \(t =0.25\) seconds, the phase of current is:

In an \(A C\) circuit with resistance \(R=1 \Omega\) and oscillating potential \(v=\) \(v_m \sin \omega t\), where \(v_m=1 V\) and \(\omega=2 \pi rad / s\), the phase difference between the current and the potential difference is:

In an \(A C\) circuit with resistance \(R=2 \Omega\) and oscillating potential \(v=v_m \sin \omega t\), where \(v_m=2 V\) and \(\omega=\frac{\pi }{2} rad / s\). The value and phase of current at \(t=0.4\) seconds is same as the value of current at time:

q_option: Current leads the voltage and both are in same phase
Current lags behind the voltage and both are in same phase
Current and voltage are in same phase
Any of the above may be true depending upon the value of resistance
